passages.text: Amercild Realty Trust COLD| \(14.90\) Outperform|Target Price/Base Case: \(\) 2000$ Commentary

We had the opportunity to visit Americold's headquarters in Atlanta this week and sit down with recently appointed CEO Rob Chambers who is taking over for outgoing CEO George Chappelle (LINK). Discussion topics included the leadership transition, operations, supply dynamics and Mr. Chambers' perspectives as he steps into the CEO role. Below we highlight important takeaways:

1. Mr. Chapelle's decision to retire was personal and not prompted by the board nor related to any performance issues. As a reminder, Mr. Chappelle stepped into the role in 2021 as interim CEO before being appointed permanent CEO in February 2022. Previously, Mr. Chappelle had served as Chairman of Agro Merchants Group which was acquired by COLD in 2020 and had extensive executive experience in the food manufacturing industry.

2. Although abrupt management changes are never easy, Mr. Chambers is well-known to the investment community and provides both continuity within the organization as well as a chance to offer a fresh perspective as the new CEO. Mr. Chambers has held various executive leadership positions at COLD since rejoining in 2020 after a stint as CFO of Saia, a trucking transportation and logistics provider. With a background in operations, logistics, and supply chain management, Mr. Chambers has led key initiatives at COLD such as the rollout and implementation of the Orion enterprise resource planning system.

3. The structural and cyclical headwinds that COLD faces will not be resolved in the short-term and Mr. Chambers will likely take some time to formulate his long-term strategic vision for the company. That said, he highlighted a few areas where COLD can continue to improve upon. These include expanding its presence in food service and retail distribution centers, working to optimize and refine revenue streams (both fixed commits and variable contracts) and value-add services, and growing its international operations, particularly in APAC where they have seen stronger customer demand relative to the US.

4. The seasonal uptick in the recent USDA data was positively received by the market, though COLD remains conservative with their 2H25 expectations and cautioned that while last Friday's release was better than anticipated, one data point does not make a trend.

5. COLD continues to take a selective approach to external growth, avoiding to do deals purely for scale. Strategic partnerships with CPKC and DP World on projects such as the import-export hub in Dubai and the rail-attached facility in Kansas City offer COLD's customers additional value-add services and provides more certainty vs. traditional greenfield developments.
Our price target is based on a weighting between our fwd NAV, our DCF estimate, and a targeted AFFO multiple applied to our forward AFFO estimate.
Food manufacturers producing at less than full capacity.
Higher costs from wages and power.
Pay as you go use and short term contracts.
Consumers cutting back on food purchases due to higher inflation or GLP- 1 usage which hurts throughput margins and potentially occupancy
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)
Time of dissemination: August 28 2025 1:26 PM ET

Evercore ISI's recommendations are based on a stock's total forecasted return over the next 12 months. Total forecasted return is equal to the expected percentage price return plus gross dividend yield. We divide our stocks under coverage into three primary ratings categories, with the following return guidelines:
Outperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be greater than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector.
In- Line- the total forecasted return is expected to be in line with the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector.
Underperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be less than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector.

Coverage Suspended- the rating and target price have been removed pursuant to Evercore ISI policy when Evercore is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving this company and in certain other circumstances.

Rating Suspended- Evercore ISI has suspended the rating and target price for this stock because there is not sufficient fundamental basis for determining, or there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints around publishing, a rating or target price. The previous rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this company and should not be relied upon.
Prior to October 10, 2015, the "Coverage Suspended" and "Rating Suspended" categories were included in the category "Suspended."

FINRA requires that members who use a ratings system with terms other than "Buy," "Hold/Neutral" and "Sell" to equate their own ratings to these categories. For this purpose, and in the Evercore ISI ratings distribution below, our Outperform, in Line, and Underperform ratings can be equated to Buy, Hold and Sell, respectively.
